private_information: I can move disks A, B, C, D, E only
I can move at most one disk at a time
agent_1.goal: Contribute to reaching the final configuration where left peg has (top->bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C; right peg is empty.

private_information: I can move disks F, G, H, I, J only
I can move at most one disk at a time
agent_2.goal: Contribute to reaching the final configuration where left peg has (top->bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C; right peg is empty.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' partial plans and produce a validated PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward planner that encodes the cooperative Tower of Hanoi task.

public_information: There are three pegs: left, middle, right.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C; right peg is empty.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only the topmost disk on a peg may be moved at any time and no disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Agents are cooperative and each agent may only move a subset of disks as specified in their private information.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are allowed to move disks A, B, C, D, E only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules: only the top disk on a peg can be moved and no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. Do not attempt to move disks outside your allowed set. Do not emit PDDL. Public information is available as {environment->public_information} and your private information is {agents->agent_1->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_1->goal}. Think step by step and produce only the ordered list of moves that agent_1 can perform given the initial configuration and the rules.
moves.prompt: You are agent_1 in a cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest). You can only move disks A, B, C, D, E. Given the initial and goal configurations described in {environment->public_information}, produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi constraints and consistent with your private movement restrictions. Output only the list of moves.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You are allowed to move disks F, G, H, I, J only. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you will perform. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the Tower of Hanoi rules: only the top disk on a peg can be moved and no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. Do not attempt to move disks outside your allowed set. Do not emit PDDL. Public information is available as {environment->public_information} and your private information is {agents->agent_2->private_information}. The global goal is {agents->agent_2->goal}. Think step by step and produce only the ordered list of moves that agent_2 can perform given the initial configuration and the rules.
moves.prompt: You are agent_2 in a cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A (smallest) through J (largest). You can only move disks F, G, H, I, J. Given the initial and goal configurations described in {environment->public_information}, produce the ordered list of primitive moves you will perform in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Ensure each move is legal under Tower of Hanoi constraints and consistent with your private movement restrictions. Output only the list of moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert with multi-agent PDDL. Your job is to integrate the ordered primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2, reconcile any conflicts or gaps, and produce a validated PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward planner. The produced PDDL must encode the Tower of Hanoi objects, initial state, goal state, and two distinct action schemas corresponding to the two agents (for example, agent_1_move and agent_2_move). Ensure the domain is compatible with FastDownward (STRIPS or ADL), and ensure actions preserve Tower of Hanoi rules. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also include a plain text comment 'Target: FastDownward' somewhere in the output. Think step by step and produce only the PDDL domain and problem enclosed in the tags.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the ordered primitive move lists from agent_1 and agent_2 as {moves_agent_1} and {moves_agent_2}. Integrate these lists into a coherent cooperative plan and produce a PDDL domain and problem that represent the full cooperative Tower of Hanoi task and are compatible with the FastDownward planner. Keep actions distinct per agent and ensure the encoding represents agent-specific move capabilities and Tower of Hanoi constraints. If the agents' lists conflict or are incomplete, reconcile them to produce a correct cooperative plan and faithful PDDL encoding. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
